radiographic_examinations.findings: The appendix is dilated to 1.2 cm with thickened walls and periappendiceal stranding. There is thickening and inflammation of the cecal base. The visualized heart is normal, lung bases are clear, liver, gallbladder, bile ducts, pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands, left kidney, and ureters are normal. No extraluminal gas or fluid collection. Small adjacent right lower quadrant mesenteric lymph nodes are not pathologically enlarged. No retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymphadenopathy.
